reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, it's expensive, but you only go around once. We enjoyed our 1 night stay at the Parador de Granada and found the room very comfortable, the view perfect and the ambiance delightful. And, we can't understand some of the reviews that faulted the service in the restaurant - our servers were attentive and helpful and the food excellent. The room was spotless and the bathroom very large and well equipped. The view from our room was into the rose garden pool with the Generalife in the distance - truly a million dollar view! Staying in the former convent that originally held the tombs of Isabella and Ferdinand is an unforgetable experience!
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Parador was supposed to be the highlight of our trip but we were very, very disappointed. We booked late and were grateful to get the last standard room for which the three of us paid almost 500 euros including breakfast. We were not even checked in when a male receptionist started trying to sell an expensive flamenco show/dinner. When we refused there was no more friendly service. The beds and bed covers were those of a one star motel quality. They charge 100 euros for the third person and what you get is one of those sofa sleeper with a mattress so thin that the springs are sticking out. (Given the size of the room, I would think better hotels would not allow a third bed.) There is no bathtub in the bathroom and there is hardly any countertop space at the sink. The dividing walls between the shower, toilet and sink area are transparent glass, which is not convenient for sharing a room. The sofa bed was ready for the third person but all else was just for two people so we had to ask for the third towel, bathrobe, etc.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere and save your money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day, I was stung by a bee right outside the front door and asked for help at the front desk but they did not offer a thing. Not even 'are you okay?' type words. Good thing I didn't have allergic reaction!
reviews.title: Location and parking convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The saving grace was breakfast which was quite good and offered a variety of items (but no cook to order item) .
reviews.title: Disappointed, not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner just before leaving town and all three of us got sick from a seafood dish (fatty white meat fish in Orange sauce). It totally ruined the next couple days. We noticed there are other hotels right by Alhambra (Hotel America was right next door). Save your money and stay elsewhere!
reviews.title: I'm glad I only came for coffee.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first Parador - very comfortable and wonderfully located, actually in the Alhambra, meaning we could explore some areas in the evenings. All so atmospheric. We had one lunch in the cafe area during our stay and it was quite beautiful to look at and delicious to eat. Good quiet room overlooking the pool. Very good breakfast and most staff polite and helpful. Good fast internet service which was very useful. We booked the 'golden oldies' deal direct with the hotel which saved us quite a lot of money.
reviews.title: As good as it gets for location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The parador is in itself a place to visit or at least have coffee if you're visiting the Alhambra. The hotel has undergone some renovations and it mixes perfectly well history and the old building with sleek rooms and modern bathrooms.
reviews.title: Really nice Parador

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was extremelly helpful and friendly and the location is one of the best in town, a short walk everywhere in the Alhambra and easy access to taxis or buses that take you to the city center and other attractions in town.
reviews.title: Our Introduction to the Paradors of Spain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast and dinner at the parador restaurant and the service and food were also very pleasant.
reviews.title: Very Noisy Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a couple of nights and left the car in the parador parking lot, which is small and gets full very easily. When we left out car was blocked by many cars ( there was a wedding reception at the parador) but the reception clerck had the keys to all the cars that were blocking the park, so he moved them out and we were able to take our car.
reviews.title: great location but poor or understaffed service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: The location is superb but the price is way out of proportion with the service and facilities.
reviews.title: Not worth the vast cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel inside Alhambra, the building used to be a convent so this is a historical building but it has been remodeled so the rooms and bathrooms are quite modern. The restaurant is quite good (try the pumpkin soup with foie gras), there is free wifi throughout the hotel, and the highlight of course is being inside La Alhambra and enjoying the beautiful views of the buildings and gardens.
reviews.title: Hotel is inside La Alhambra so you will never find a better location in Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a great hotel but what makes it unique is its location inside the Alhambra. I would say that if you visit the Alhambra (which will probably be only once or twice in your life) then this is simply the number 1 place where you would want to stay. And that is basically all that is important to know about this hotel.
reviews.title: An integral part of visiting the Alhambra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This parador is in our opinion the best that we have stayed in. The parador is another of the museum types and has the most beautiful decor and grounds, our room was very comfortable. The hotel restaurant was rather bland in decor considering that the parador is set in an old monastery, but served the most excellent food, with very attentive staff.
reviews.title: Amazing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The position of the hotel could not have been better, with the most amazing views.
reviews.title: Best way to see La Alhambra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the Parador thankfully sent an advance email to describe the route to the place, I missed the correct lane after the roundabout at the parking, anyhow soon found the way. One really drives into the Alhambra Palace which is a privilege of itself. The reception personnel was friendly and really helpful, the room a delight in every respect, there was a coffee maker and slippers, you usually don't have in a Parador. Bed very comfortable, and view of the old Hamam bath ruins and the Generalife. The building itself with patio, gardens, original fountains, etc. is beautiful and full of history. Enjoyed dinner and breakfast, latter was plentiful and high quality. After just one night we had to leave early (about 10 AM) as we had purchased tickets via internet for the Alhambra where one must be on time (11.30 AM printed on tocket) to enter the Nasrid Palace.
reviews.title: Magnificent Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a superior double room on the Keytel Website for two nights half board. On arrival we were allocated Room 209 which the reception assured me was a superior double. The room, on the first floor, was next to the lift shaft and half our room was taken up by the lift shaft housing. There was no carpet on the corridor outside our room so everytime anyone walked past you were disturbed by a constant clatter of footsteps on the floor. The shower area over the bath was dirty with cracked tiles on the wall around the window.
reviews.title: Five Star Location and Prices, Two Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: On the first night our bed was turned down and floormats put out. No repeat of this on the second night however!
reviews.title: Big waste of money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The plus side for this hotel is it`s location which is right inside the grounds of the Alhambra. The food was of a high standard but the restaurant was freezing cold and some of the diners sat with their overcoats on throughout the whole meal, a fact which staff seemed oblivious to. What heating there was seemed to go off around 9pm
reviews.title: Nice location but..some unacceptable things at that price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don`t linger too long with your partner over dinner as staff are very keen to get you out of the restaurant as quickly as possible with food plates being taken away from us before we had even finished the meal!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience
